title: ENV S145 Final Project
text:
This report aims to answer the question, “Could changing our food systems solve the climate crisis?” My project group approached this analysis by using a bottom-up structure to look at each level of the food system and its contribution to greenhouse gas emissions as well as the mitigation potential within each level.
You can read the full report by clicking the button below:
Open Google Doc

title: Interests
text:
Music / Drumming
Since watching the film Bohemian Rhapsody in high school, I have been inspired to become a musician and perform live. Last fall, I met with some musicians to jam and since then we’ve been performing as an indie/alt rock band around Isla Vista!

title: About
text:
BioResearch InterestsEducation


Hi! I’m Emily Lombardi, a student passionate about integrating environmental science, sustainability, and social justice. I’m particularly interested in learning how to address environmental challenges through solutions that also promote social equity— specifically by improving food security, increasing access to healthy, affordable food, and reducing our reliance on industrial agriculture.



Climate change mitigation

Sustainable food systems / food security
Environmental communication



Bachelor’s of Science, Environmental Studies University of California, Santa Barbara, Sep 2022 - June 2026

title: ENV S116 Final Project
text:
Jakarta, the capital of Indonesia, is a major port city. It’s built on a delta and 13 rivers flow through the city before entering Jakarta Bay. The metropolis is also the center of administration, economy, culture, and entertainment. However, 40% of Jakarta is below sea level and Northern parts of the city are seeing a land subsidence rate of 11 inches per year, putting the homes of 4.5 million people at risk of flooding. Additionally, less than half of the population has access to piped water…
